contact_name: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union
description: The four indicators provided are GERD (Gross domestic expenditure on R&D) as a percentage of GDP, percentage of GERD financed by industry, percentage of GERD financed by government and percentage of GERD financed from abroad. "Research and experimental development (R&D) comprise creative work undertaken on a systematic basis in order to increase the stock of knowledge, including knowledge of man, culture and society and the use of this stock of knowledge to devise new applications" (Frascati Manual, 2002 edition, § 63 ). R&D is an activity where there are significant transfers of resources between units, organisations and sectors and it is important to trace the flow of R&D funds.
title: Gross domestic expenditure on R&D (GERD)
name: SxOwjtK4u1pDIeSPwi7A

rdf:about="http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/product?code=tgite230">     <dct:description xml:lang="en">The four indicators provided are GERD (Gross domestic expenditure on R&D) as a percentage of GDP, percentage of GERD financed by industry, percentage of GERD financed by government and percentage of GERD financed from abroad. "Research and experimental development (R&D) comprise creative work undertaken on a systematic basis in order to increase the stock of knowledge, including knowledge of man, culture and society and the use of this stock of knowledge to devise new applications" (Frascati Manual, 2002 edition, § 63 ). R&D is an activity where there are significant transfers of resources between units, organisations and sectors and it is important to trace the flow of R&D funds.</dct:description>     <dct:modified>2012-06-18</dct:modified>     <ecodp:datasetStatus rdf:resource="http://open-data.europa.eu/kos/dataset-status/Completed"/>     <dcat:distribution rdf:nodeID="A4"/>     <dct:title xml:lang="en">Gross domestic expenditure on R&D (GERD)</dct:title>     <dct:license rdf:resource="http://open-data.europa.eu/kos/licence/EuroStat"/>     <dct:title xml:lang="de">Bruttoinlandsausgaben für FuE (GERD)</dct:title>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Dataset"/>     <ecodp:contactPoint rdf:resource="http://ec.europa.eu/dgs/information_society"/>     <ecodp:isDocumentedBy rdf:nodeID="A3"/>     <dcat:distribution rdf:nodeID="A1"/>     <dct:description xml:lang="de">Diese vier Indikatoren sind GERD als Prozentanteil des BIP, Prozentanteil von industriefinanziertem GERD, Prozentanteil von regierungsfinanziertem GERD und Prozentanteil von auslandsfinanziertem GERD. Unter Forschung und Entwicklung (FuE) wird eine kreative Tätigkeit auf einer systematischen Basis verstanden, mit dem Ziel, neue Kenntnisse - einschließlich Menschen-, Landes- und Gesellschaftskunde - zu gewinnen, sowie den Kenntnisbestand für neue Anwendungen zu nutzen (Frascati Manual, 2002 edition, § 63). FuE ist eine Tätigkeit, in der wichtige Transfers zwischen Einheiten, Organisationen und Sektoren stattfinden; dabei ist es wichtig, FuE-Fonds zu verfolgen.</dct:description>     <dct:temporal rdf:nodeID="A2"/>     <dct:description xml:lang="fr">Les quatre indicateurs fournis sont: DIRD en pourcentage du PIB, pourcentage des DIRD financées par l'industrie, pourcentage des DIRD financées par les pouvoirs publics et pourcentage des DIRD financées par l'étranger. «La recherche et le développement expérimental (R&D) englobent les travaux de création entrepris de façon systématique en vue d'accroître la somme des connaissances, y compris la connaissance de l'homme, de la culture et de la société, ainsi que l'utilisation de cette somme de connaissances pour de nouvelles applications» (Manuel de Frascati, édition 2002, § 63). Les activités de R&D se caractérisent par des transferts massifs de ressources entre unités, organisations et secteurs qu'il est important d'observer.</dct:description>     <dct:publisher rdf:resource="http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/corporate-body/ESTAT"/>     <dct:identifier>tgite230</dct:identifier>     <dcat:distribution rdf:nodeID="A0"/>     <dct:title xml:lang="fr">Dépense intérieure brute de R&D (DIRD)</dct:title>     <ecodp:datasetType rdf:resource="http://open-data.europa.eu/kos/dataset-type/Statistical"/>   </rdf:Description>   <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://open-data.europa.eu/kos/licence/EuroStat">     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/>   </rdf:Description>   <rdf:Description rdf:nodeID="A4">     <ecodp:distributionFormat>application/x-gzip</ecodp:distributionFormat>     <dct:description xml:lang="en">Download dataset in DFT format</dct:description>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat#Download"/>     <dcat:accessURL rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#anyURI">http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/NavTree_prod/everybody/BulkDownloadListing?file=data/tgite230.dft.gz</dcat:accessURL>   </rdf:Description>   <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://open-data.europa.eu/kos/documentation-type/RelatedWebPage">     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Concept"/>   </rdf:Description> <dcat:Catalog xmlns:foaf="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/#" xmlns:ecodp="http://open-data.europa.eu/ontologies/ec-odp#" xmlns:dct="http://purl.org/dc/terms/#" rdf:about="http://open-data.europa.eu/"><dcat:record><dcat:CatalogRecord rdf:about="http://open-data.europa.eu/data/dataset/SxOwjtK4u1pDIeSPwi7A"><foaf:primaryTopic>http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/product?code=tgite230</foaf:primaryTopic><dct:modified>2012-12-12T14:08:36.084074</dct:modified><dct:issued>2012-12-12T14:08:36.084074</dct:issued></dcat:CatalogRecord></dcat:record></dcat:Catalog></rdf:RDF>
